value.title: DAX Fridays! #49: SELECTEDVALUE
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will go through the DAX function SELECTEDVALUE. SELECTEDVALUE is syntax sugar for IF(HASONEVALUE(VALUES))  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/selectedvalue-dax Link to Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Fridays! #66: TREATAS
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS.  The TREATAS DAX function allows us to create virtual relationships within tables or pass filters to tables that are not related.  Link to function in glossary:  https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/treatas-dax   Link to SQLBI blog post: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/propagate-filters-using-treatas-in-dax/

value.title: DAX Fridays! #79: KEEPFILTERS
value.excerpt: In today's video we are going through the DAX function KEEPFILTERS. KEEPFILTERS will remove the behaviour that CALCULATE has where it removes the filters available. value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify.   For example, if you want to calculate the sum of sales between two specific dates, this is the perfect function for you.  You can "hardcode" the

value.title: Dynamically find header rows and promote them in Power Query
value.excerpt: Dynamically find a column header and promote them in power query is  a very common requirement, specially if you are importing data from excel or pdfs for example.  In today's video, I will show you how to do that with just a few simple steps!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Export Power Query data into SQL and do incremental refresh - Power BI Tips & Tricks #49
value.excerpt: In today’s video I will show you how to export data from power query or power bi into SQL. Really useful for example if you want to come around the limitiation of the lack of increment loads functionality in Power BI.  Some important links: BIInsight blog: http://biinsight.com/exporting-power-bi-data-to-sql-server/

value.title: Get data from zip files without extracting them in Power Query

Here is Marks blog, where you can find his function: http://sql10.blogspot.se/2016/06/reading-zip-files-in-powerquery-m.html

value.title: Power BI Tips & Tricks #07: Change multiple hardcoded path sources at once in Power BI
value.excerpt: If you have opened a power bi file on a different computer that has excel, csv, txt as source files, you probably have seen the error message telling you that Power bI could not find a part of the path.  I am going to show you an easy way to solve this.  Here you can download the pbix file: http://trantor.synology.me:5000/fbsharing/nc9kfXTw

value.title: Power BI vs Excel: When you should use each tool
value.excerpt: Which tool is best? Power BI or Excel?  Well, it depends on what you are trying to do. Both tools have unique strengths and limitations and in this video I will try to show both.  Hopefully after watching this video, you will have a better understanding of both tools and will know when to use which depending
